revised_title: A Study of the Pharmacology and Effects of Ethyl Chloride as an Anaesthetic
tldr: This study investigates the pharmacology and effects of ethyl chloride as an anaesthetic, focusing on its solubility in water and blood, its impact on the heart, and its effects on the vascular system. The research demonstrates that ethyl chloride has a paralytic effect on heart muscle, but a larger quantity is required compared to chloroform for similar results. The study also highlights the importance of further research to ensure the safety of this anaesthetic agent.
